plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A hardy perennial or biennial native to North America, Black-eyed Susan features bright yellow, daisy-like petals with a dark brown central cone. It thrives in wild meadows and gardens alike, often blooming into autumn.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are named for their distinctive dark centers resembling a pupil surrounded by yellow petals.

plants.name: Chrysanthemum Ã— morifolium
plants.description: Widely cultivated for its stunning flower diversity, Garden Chrysanthemum blooms in autumn with vibrant flowers ranging from white to red, pink, and yellow. It is a traditional flower of fall gardens in temperate zones worldwide.
plants.location: Worldwide cultivation, originally native to East Asia
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are often associated with autumn festivals and are symbols of longevity and rejuvenation in many Asian cultures.

plants.name: Fuchsia magellanica
plants.description: This semi-evergreen shrub produces exotic, pendulous flowers in shades of pink, purple, and red, attracting hummingbirds. Blooming often extends into late autumn especially in mild coastal climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late summer to October (sometimes longer in mild climates)
plants.location: Southern South America (wild), widely cultivated in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Hummingbird Fuchsia is named for its main pollinatorsâ€”hummingbirdsâ€”drawn by its bright colors and nectar.

plants.name: Cyclamen hederifolium
plants.description: A bulbous perennial that flowers from late summer through autumn, Cyclamen hederifolium has distinctive upswept pink or white flowers and beautifully variegated ivy-shaped leaves. It's found naturally in woodland and rocky areas around the Mediterranean basin.
plants.funFact: Cyclamen tubers were historically used in folk medicine but can be toxic if eaten.
